Egypt

From the banks of the Nile, where pharaohs once commanded empires, comes a tradition of sweetness that has endured millennia. Egyptian desserts carry the warmth of the sun and the wisdom of ancient craft.

Rose waterOrange blossomPistachioHoneyCream

Mastered Sweets

Legendary desserts perfected over generations

CheeseSyrupPistachio

Kunafa

Shredded phyllo dough layered with sweet cheese, soaked in fragrant rose syrup and topped with crushed pistachios.

CrispyGooeyFloralNutty
SemolinaSyrupAlmond

Basbousa

Semolina cake soaked in aromatic syrup, crowned with almonds. A texture that melts on the tongue.

DenseSweetGrainyRich
PuddingNutsRaisins

Om Ali

Egyptian bread pudding with milk, nuts, and raisins. A royal dessert with a legendary origin.

CreamyWarmSpicedComforting
CookieFilledTraditional

Kahk

Ancient Egyptian cookies filled with malban or nuts, dusted with powdered sugar. A taste of history.

ButterySweetDelicateNutty
PancakeFilledFried

Qatayef

Stuffed pancakes filled with cream or nuts, folded into perfect half-moons and fried to golden perfection.

CrispyCreamySweetRich

Craft Techniques

The ancient arts that transform simple ingredients into legendary desserts.

01

Phyllo mastery — paper-thin dough stretched to transparency

02

03

Nut roasting — bringing out deep, complex flavors

04
